node.title: Govt says' targeted support' on the way for hospitality firms
node.description: Cafes and restaurants on the brink of collapse because of Covid-19 restrictions are being promised some relief by the government but still don't know what that will be.

node.title: January 6 committee subpoenas others tied to false elector scheme
node.description: The panel's chair Bennie Thompson said the committee has found the plan was directed at least in part from the former president's campaign.

node.title: Bill to ban conversion practices passes third reading
node.description: The Conversion Practices Prohibition Legislation Bill has passed its third and final reading in Parliament, with the support of almost all MPs.

node.title: House prices expected to fall further than previously forecast - ASB
node.description: The seemingly out of control housing market is being pegged back, with expectations of a greater fall in prices than previously thought.

node.title: Otago Girls' High School pupil attacked, hijab ripped off by fellow students
node.description: An Otago schoolgirl ended up in hospital with a concussion after three other pupils ripped her hijab off and beat her.

node.title: New Zealand sprinter happy to end Springbok ambitions
node.description: A budding Springbok as a youngster, sprinter Tiaan Whelpton is hoping to finally pull on the black singlet and represent New Zealand.

node.title: Sea levels to rise more than a foot by 2050, study projects
node.description: The forecasted increase over the next 30 years could amount to the same rise seen over the last 100 years.

node.title: Parliament protests: Tragedy or farce?
node.description: Opinion - Watching the anti-mandate protests in Wellington over the past week, it has been impossible to ignore similarities to 1960s and '70s counterculture. But there are also some notableâ€¦

node.title: Coachella won't require masks, negative COVID tests or vaccinations
node.description: Guests will also not be required to bring masks.

node.title: Prepare to pay premium for Valentine's Day roses
node.description: Imports of roses have been affected by shipping delays and hot weather has stunted the growth of New Zealand grown roses.

node.title: Global dairy prices hit their highest level in eight years
node.description: The average price at the fortnightly global dairy auction rose 4.2 percent to US$4840 per tonne (NZ$7294), after rising 4.1 percent in the previous auction.

node.title: Covid-19: How schools are bracing for Omicron
node.description: Principals are isolating themselves and making teachers work in separate bubbles in an attempt to slow the spread of omicron in their schools.

node.title: ViacomCBS announces new company name: Paramount
node.description: "This is an exciting moment in the history of our company," Bob Bakish and Shari Redstone said in a memo announcing the new name.

node.title: Streaming services raise prices, stinging cord-cutters
node.description: Prices will continue to climb as streamers invest billions in original content to stand out from competition.

node.title: St John of God deny cover-up of historical abuse
node.description: The head of the St John of God Order in Oceania has denied that a lack of documents relating to historical allegations of abuse at Marylands School was a cover-up.

node.title: Senate Republicans boycott Biden's Federal Reserve nominees
node.description: Republicans on the Senate Banking Committee skipped Tuesday's meeting, denying Democrats the quorum needed to advance Biden nominees.

node.title: Biden says Russian invasion of Ukraine "remains distinctly possible," but there's still room for diplomacy
node.description: The president's address at the White House came after Ukrainian officials said Tuesday that some of their national security and financial sites were under attack by hackers.

node.title: Homicide investigation launched after man dies in Waikato Hospital
node.description: Police have launched a homicide investigation following the death of a 57-year-old man in Waikato Hospital yesterday.

node.title: Still hope for Ukraine agreement - US and UK
node.description: The United States and United Kingdom leaders have said not all hope is lost for a diplomatic solution to the Ukraine crisis, but warn that the situation remains fragile.

node.title: Ukraine tensions drive gas prices to highest level in years
node.description: U.S. motorists are paying roughly a dollar more per gallon than they were a year ago, AAA data shows.

node.title: Politicians react as bill to ban conversion therapy passes
node.description: Legislation banning conversion therapy has passed its third and final reading at Parliament with the support of almost all MPs.

node.title: Jury rejects Sarah Palin's libel claim against The New York Times
node.description: Palin had claimed the newspaper maliciously damaged her reputation by erroneously linking her campaign rhetoric to a mass shooting.

node.title: Towies 'sympathetic' to Parliament protesters, tow truck operator says
node.description: A tow truck operator says the reason towies won't move the vehicles illegally blocking streets outside Parliament is not due to safety concerns - it's because they sympathise with the protesters. Audio

node.title: 4 teens among 8 aboard plane that crashed off North Carolina coast
node.description: The group ranged in age from 15 to 67.

node.title: Biden administration floating more federal funding for COVID-19 response
node.description: The Biden administration is gauging support more money to pay for testing, treatment programs and development of vaccines to fight the virus and future diseases.

node.title: Sadowski-Synnott settles for silver in Big Air
node.description: Snowboarder Zoi Sadowski-Synnott was pipped in the women's Big Air final at the Beijing Winter Olympics.

node.title: Man arrested on cruise ship is latest to be accused of stealing Hertz car
node.description: "I am one of their best customers. And here I am sitting in jail," Hertz customer Charles Doucette said.

node.title: Luxon supports Ardern's refusal to meet with Parliament protesters
node.description: The National leader will not negotiate with the protesters and says they are difficult to engage with given their "anti-social, abusive" behaviour. National's whole caucus has agreed not to meet them.

node.title: RNZ in-depth: The best long reads for summer
node.description: 2021 was a year of fast-moving Covid-19 news, but RNZ's in-depth team also produced some exceptional long reads. As you slow down over summer, check out some of the best of the past year here.

node.title: Queenstown records more Covid-19 cases and locations of interest
node.description: Queenstown has recorded another 22 new Covid-19 cases bringing its total to 56.
